messages.message: Two options -- if local builds don't use docker, and all the dev/staging/prod builds run on a build machine -- then that should be fine. If not, we can just migrate to minikube -- in that case you don't need docker desktop, it comes bundled with docker engine (https://dhwaneetbhatt.com/blog/run-docker-without-docker-desktop-on-macos)
I think minikube is the best option forward here. It’s helpful to build services in Docker locally before pushing to sanity check package dependencies.

We can also try out podman (https://docs.podman.io/en/latest/). It’s as easy as setting `alias docker=podman`

Podman was developed by RedHat and intended to be the drop in replacement for Docker CLI.
if podman cli and docker cli support same commands with same behavior (I assume podman supports any container that follow OCI format)  -- that should work

>  The core Podman runtime environment can only run on Linux operating systems. But other operating systems can use the “remote client” to manage their containers to a Linux backend.
(https://github.com/containers/podman/blob/main/docs/tutorials/mac_win_client.md)
would every engineer need access to a Linux dev machine then?
